author: [Anonymous]
text:
We are evaluating the cost/benefit of outsourcing our Payroll and HR systems and related administrative support work.   We are a City with 1600 employees and over 50% of our employees are represented by numerous bargaining units.   I would be interested in hearing what other Cities (particularly any of comparable size- but not limited to that) have learned from conducting a similar evaluation; and from those that have outsourced- what the outcome has been.   I would be interested in hearing about successes, challenges and outright failures so that we can make a thoughtful and informed decision.   We currently outsource management of  our health and welfare benefits successfully but have realized that the system cost of supporting these function with a workforce of 1600 just doesn't provide the economies of scale that we think an outsourcer could gain.  But...we recognize that there is likely a trade off in service, etc.
For those that have done this successfully- have you measured the actual savings/benefits?
For those that have not been successful- why do you think it didn't work?
For those that evaluated and decided not to outsource- what was the driver for the decision?
title: Payroll/HR Outsourcing
